channel.title: Books on Learn, Converse, Share
channel.description: Recent content in Books on Learn, Converse, Share

item.title: Pro Git Cliff Notes
item.description: These are my notes from reading Scott Chacon’s Pro Git I highly suggest buying this book if you are serious about using the Git version control tool. pg 48 A branch in Git is simply a lightweight movable pointer pg 50 a special pointer called HEAD…is a pointer to the local branch you’re currently on pg 52 Creating a new branch is as quick and simple as writing 41 bytes to a file (40 characters and a newline).

item.title: Thoughts about reading computer books
item.description: I have been coding ASP.NET for about 4 years now. I had a co-worker bring a book to work titled “Essential ASP.NET” by Fritz Onion. I skimmed it and it looked very interesting do to it’s text on application pools and low level information that I’ve always taken for granted. I finished reading a few of the other books lounging around my house and decided that I wanted to read it.
